intro: Bruinsmia polysperma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Bruinsmia polysperma is often found in disturbed soils and can become a weed in agricultural settings.
